ciklum.description: On behalf of EC English, Ciklum is looking for a Project Manager with experience in coordination of distributed teams to join an agile development team based in Kyiv, Ukraine.

•	Proven experience with managing more than 10 developers/IT specialists/QA members
•	Experience in managing internationally distributed teams
•	3-5 years of experience as a JIRA Software / Confluence Administrator 
•	Proven project management and planning skills and a history of delivering projects on time

ciklum.description:
On behalf of the New Client, Ciklum is looking for Site Reliability Engineer to join Kyiv team on a full-time basis.
The Company is building next generation cloud infrastructure with a specific focus on enterprises workloads.
ciklum.title: Site Reliability Engineer for Ciklum Client (Kyiv)
ciklum.vacancy:
•	7+ years of experience of increasing responsibility in a technical support and data center operations roles, including team and process management responsibilities. Experience with Cloud data centers is a must.
•	Prior successful experience of working in an innovative, fast-paced startup with a high rate of flux. The candidate must demonstrate strong entrepreneurial spirit and vigor.
•	Demonstrated proficiency in creating detailed technical design documents, facilitate design reviews, and execution of design implementation projects.
•	Ability to communicate with Network Architects
•	BS/MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience  
•	Must be an excellent verbal and written communicator 
•	Deep technical roots in data center technologies:
o	Large-scale Linux production environments, preferably as part of a Cloud service provider environment.
o	Understand datacenter networking fabric topologies and common architectures deployed
o	Virtualization technologies, in particular VMware product suite (vCenter, ESXi) is required. 
o	Deep understanding with cluster management systems like Kubernetes and Docker based container deployments is required.
o	Deep understanding of Logstash, ElasticSearch, Mysql Database, PostgresSQL
o	Deep understanding of KVM, Microsoft technologies (Hyper-V, Azure Pack, Azure Stack) is a strong plus.
o	Experience in Networking concepts is required — Layer 2/3, Load Balancers, VPN, Network Virtualization, BGP, OSPF
o	Reasonable technical understanding of configuration and maintenance of different NAS/SAN and networking systems in a virtualized environment. Understanding of Software Defined Data Center (SDS, SDN) is a strong plus.
o	Understanding of DevOps agility for continuous development and delivery with Chef / Puppet / Ansible. 
o	Deep understanding of ITIL processes and systems, such ITSM (ServiceNow) is a strong plus.
o	Professional Certifications in Particular VCP, VCP-DCV, VCP-CMA is a strong plus Personal skills:
•	Open-minded, flexible and thriving in a dynamic, ever-changing environment
•	Excellent interpersonal skills
•	Strong problem-solving abilities
•	Self-learning skills •	Unique working environment where you communicate and work directly with client
•	Business trips to United States
•	Variety of knowledge sharing, training and self-development opportunities •	You will be responsible for the systems deployment, operations, and monitoring for our infrastructure, including design and development of infrastructure automation. 
•	You will get your hands dirty, troubleshooting infrastructure, and architectural challenges using your existing knowledge and toolkits.
•	You will drive reliability and supportability aspects of Cloud service by creating knowledgebase and, working with DevOps, coordinate change management policies, deploy ticket/incident management system, service request queue triaging and auto-remediation. 
•	You will utilize your advanced system architecture & administration skills for collaboration with engineering and product management, test and automation teams to architect and develop strategic and tactical solutions. 
•	You will implement, support and maintain a repository of microservices through kubernetes based pods.
•	You will engage with suppliers for the purposes of infrastructure equipment procurement, technical design exercises, and supplier roadmap reviews.
•	You will help develop requirements for customer onboarding processes, target environment sizing and migration automations.

Bachelor’s Degree, Diploma or Equivalent and 5+ Years’ experience in full stack development
The ability to work independently and collaboratively with the team. Integrity, adaptability and excellent communication skills. A passion for lifelong learning and exceptional problems solving skills.
Ninja Skills, as below:
•	Embrace SOLID Principles 
•	Must have worked extensively with design patterns in architecting solutions
•	Extensive experience in building large backend systems using C#, ASP.NET MVC/WebAPI, MS SQL

•	Exposure to automation testing frameworks, especially Selenium, would be great as this is used in they CI/CD flow.
•	Our client use Trunk-Based Development with GIT as part of his CI/CD process, so exposure to this would be ideal!
•	Exposure to Service Fabric, Orleans, Event Hubs advantageous
•	Extensive experience building large frontend applications in TypeScript / JavaScript 
•	A passion for building engaging UX and UI using HTML5, CSS3/LESS is essential 
•	Exposure to Virtual Dom (i.e. HTML Dom abstraction) ideal
•	Canvas / WebGL experience essential while experience with PixiJS is ideal as this customer’s library of choice. You will be helping Derivco, along with the Team Lead and Senior Tester, to create the new team in Kiev. You will be also working closely with the other development and IT teams located in Durban — South Africa, Douglas — Isle of Mann and Tallinn — Estonia. They need your help in mentoring and coaching more junior developers.
Although our customer has a large codebase, existing standards and well-defined processes, they are always looking for new technology to take advantage of and are always keen to embrace change! Derivco embraces innovation in everything they do (and hand out some pretty cool prizes for it as well). 
They are convinced that they employs some of the smartest people in the business, so if you like being challenged and feel that you could contribute, Derivco look forward to hearing from you! Bachelor’s Degree, Diploma or Equivalent and 5+ Years’ experience in full stack development
The ability to work independently and collaboratively with the team. Integrity, adaptability and excellent communication skills. A passion for lifelong learning and exceptional problems solving skills.
Ninja Skills, as below:
•	Embrace SOLID Principles

•	Extensive experience in building large backend systems using C#, ASP.NET MVC/WebAPI, MS SQL
•	Unit testing is a must as Derivco use a TDD approach to development using Karma/Jasmine and nUnit frameworks with all code produced
•	Exposure to automation testing frameworks, especially Selenium, would be great as this is used in they CI/CD flow.
•	Our client use Trunk-Based Development with GIT as part of his CI/CD process, so exposure to this would be ideal!
•	Exposure to Service Fabric, Orleans, Event Hubs advantageous
•	Extensive experience building large frontend applications in TypeScript / JavaScript 
•	A passion for building engaging UX and UI using HTML5, CSS3/LESS is essential 
•	Exposure to Virtual Dom (i.e. HTML Dom abstraction) ideal
•	Canvas / WebGL experience essential while experience with PixiJS is ideal as this customer’s library of choice.

On behalf of Derivco Company, Ciklum is looking for a Senior Tester Engineer to join Kyiv team on a full-time basis.
https://derivco.com/ | www.microgaming.co.uk 
Derivco is the dev house that provides Microgaming with their exceptional gaming content.

ciklum.vacancy:
Bachelor’s Degree, Diploma OR Equivalent and 5+ years testing experience with exposure to agile testing environments ISTQB Test Analyst/Manager or equivalent.
The ability to work independently and collaboratively with the team. Integrity, adaptability and excellent communication skills. A passion for lifelong learning and exceptional problems solving skills.
A driven person with good time management and great attention to detail, combined with the ability to deal with ambiguity and drive solutions, independently or collaboratively. 
Ninja Skills, as below:
•	Strong testing technical ability across multiple platforms (SQL, Web, Service and Mobile)
•	Good understanding and use of testing Processes and Techniques
•	Great Mentoring/Coaching ability 
•	Strong test analysis, preparation and planning skills 
•	Good knowledge of different testing methods, techniques and types Automation 
•	Create and drive automation test strategy and assets. 
•	Being able to automate using WebDriver (Selenium), TypeScript/JavaScript and Ranorex, C# 
•	Experience of working with version control systems (GIT)
•	Experience Integrating automated testing into CI process using TeamCity
•	Embracing change in a dynamic agile environment
•	The ability to foresee and create improvements to existing testing procedures as needed. You will be helping our client, along with the Project Manager and Senior Developer, to create they new team in Kiev. You will also be working closely with other customer’s development and IT teams located in Durban — South Africa, Douglas — Isle of Mann and Tallinn — Estonia. Derivco needs your help in mentoring and coaching more junior testers and automation engineer.
Although our client have a large system, existing standards and well-defined processes, they are always looking for new approaches to take advantage of and are always keen to embrace change! They embrace innovation in everything they do (and hand out some pretty cool prizes for it as well). 
Derivco are convinced that they employ some of the smartest people in the business, so if you like being challenged and feel that you could contribute, they look forward to hearing from you! You will provide testing technical leadership in developing and implementing testing strategies, plans and scenarios for customer cross-platform (iOS, Android, Windows, macOS) poker client and the backend services which support it. You will support team alignment with organizational initiatives and objectives, whilst safeguarding customer’s architecture and growing product awareness of the poker product.
Additionally, you will work with client’s Test Managers, Team Leads and Senior Testers to facilitate the evolution of they backend platform to the latest .NET cloud technologies.

https://derivco.com/ | www.microgaming.co.uk 

We’re the dev house that provides Microgaming with their exceptional gaming content.
ciklum.title: Team Lead/Project Manager for Derivco (Kyiv)
ciklum.vacancy:
Bachelor’s Degree, Diploma or Equivalent and 7+ Years’ experience in software development with at least 2+ of these in a leadership role. The ability to lead from the front, independently and collaboratively with the team. Integrity, adaptability and fluent English communication skills. A passion for lifelong learning, exceptional problems solving skills and embraces innovation.  Master Ninja Skills, as below:
•	Excellent leadership skills
•	Excellent communication skills
•	Extensive experience in Agile/SCRUM
•	Background in development, ideally full stack development
•	Mentoring and Coaching skills
•	Experience in facilitating continuous improvement
•	Experience in hiring and growing awesome teams
•	Ability to keep a team consistently and openly engaged
•	Ability to identify new product ideas and areas for innovation
•	Experience working with other remote teams would be ideal The opportunity for you to create your own team in Kiev for Derivco. You will be supported and working closely with our other development and IT teams located in Durban — South Africa, Douglas — Isle of Mann and Tallinn — Estonia. We need your help in leading the team members as you join us in creating a truly awesome poker product.
Although we have a large codebase, existing standards and well-defined processes, we are always looking for new technology to take advantage of and are always keen to embrace change! We embrace innovation in everything we do (and hand out some pretty cool prizes for it as well). 
We’re convinced that we employ some of the smartest people in the business, so if you like being challenged and feel that you could contribute, we look forward to hearing from you! You, along with a Senior Developer and Senior Testers, will help us build a new cross-functional team (5 Developers and 5 Testers) in Kiev.  This team will form part of the larger Poker Team and you will be working closely with the Product Owner, Project Team, and other Technical Leads in adding new features to our cross-platform (iOS, Android, Windows, macOS) poker client and the backend systems which support it. You will support team alignment with organizational values, initiatives and objectives, whilst growing product awareness of the poker product and providing strategic direction for the team. On a day to day basis you will oversee development and testing of features while you ensure that quality and standards are maintained. Additionally, you will facilitate the daily SCRUM standup and help ensure all impediments are removed for the team. You will also keep the Product and Project teams up to date on the sprint progress and help facilitate communication with international teams whenever required.

•	Removing all obstacles to Clients’ satisfaction and / or financial performance.
•	Driving the local PM Community and work at increasing managerial and business competence level. Requirements:
•	Delivery / Project Management experience and good commercial understanding, ideally within Managed Services and IT Outsourcing industry.

ciklum.vacancy:
Ciklum is looking for an experienced Solution Architect to join Ciklum Architecture Group. In this role you will have great opportunity to work with clients across Europe, US and Israel at the executive level (CIO/ CTO/ COO), participate in business development and solution delivery and be a part of a successful and growing team and utilise your experience in building and growing solution practices in one of technology domains such as Enterprise Applications, Web Services, Mobile Applications or eCommerce Solutions. Responsibilities:
Pre-sales activities:
•	Client engagement up to C level and senior stakeholder management — the ability to communicate the company strategy, solutions, services and technology stacks to key clients and stakeholders, build rapport and trust with the client;
•	Play key role in preparing proposals and bids for medium to large opportunities;
•	Work together with Project Manager on estimation, planning and scoping of the projects;
•	Advising and consulting potential clients on Ciklum solutions and services capabilities based on their needs and expectations;
Solution Architecture design and Technology advisory:
•	Architect, design and develop custom solutions of project and program or operational scope (end-to-end: hardware, software, integration, security etc. for the entire solution delivery life cycle)
•	Oversee platform selection as well as HW, SW, security and network components
•	Create project teams together with Project Manager, Business Analyst, Developers and QA teams to scope, plan, design, deliver, test and deploy end-to-end solutions
•	Act as most Senior technical expert on the project, provides inputs to Developers and QA teams
•	Design complete Solution Architecture based on business, operational and technical analysis
•	Write Technical and Application Specs based on collected catalogue of product requirements
Solutions Practice work:
•	Contribute in the development of new Ciklum Services Portfolio, Ciklum Services Catalogue and modifications to methodologies, tools, build Solutions knowledge library with Reference Architecture

We embrace new ideas and work together to build a better Hopster. Everyone gets as much responsibility as they can handle and, as a rapidly growing company, we’d expect to offer people who perform well plenty of future growth opportunities.
We’re a techy bunch, we’re always looking for ways to do things better, whether it’s improving the performance of an API, improving music compression in the app or exploring the latest Javascript framework. •	C#

•	Designing and developing systems for both high availability and scalability
•	Performance profiling and tuning
•	Working with message queues and event-driven services Personal qualities:
Our principles are at the core of how we meet our responsibilities. As a member of your team, you’ll need to demonstrate those principles and make them a core part of how you work day to day:
•	Do the right thing 
•	Take responsibility 
•	Be transparent 
•	Continuously improve
•	Take pride •	We’ll believe and trust in you and your abilities. So you and your team will have the authority to make the technical decisions you need to meet your responsibilities to the rest of the platform and company.

•	Regular hackathons — use your imagination, ideas and technologies of your choice to innovate and deliver prototypes of new products. Every member of the Technology team is responsible for: 
•	The availability, security, scalability of our ecommerce platform 
•	Delivering our product roadmap 
•	Planning for the future  We don’t divide responsibility for development and operation of our platform, so you and your team will support the changes you make all the way through to operating successfully in production at peak times.
The Senior Engineer takes technical ownership of a subset of the team’s work, ensuring that changes are technically sound, scalable, secure, in line with the rest of the platform and of a high quality.
Key capabilities: •	Be a trusted technical authority and specialist in one or more areas of their team.
•	Has a deep knowledge of JUST EAT’s business model and practices

●	A passion for UX and irresistible desire to learn and improve.
●	2 + years of experience as a UX designer/interaction designer/information architect or similar role.
●	Understanding of modern UX design principles and methodologies.
●	Effective communication skills in English — you should be able to elicit project details and clearly articulate your design decisions. 
●	Experience with analytics tools and user testing is a plus. ●	The projects are various, which gives you a lot of new experience and challenges. 
●	Opportunity to travel abroad for a workshop and work with international customers directly.
●	Share and receive knowledge while collaborating closely with experienced teams of designers and developers.
●	Take part in shaping our work processes and the growing design team. 
●	Participate in our regular knowledge sharing events, training sessions, and inside-the-team design review meetings.
●	A cozy office, our own gym (with a TRX), table tennis & football. ●	Analyze project requirements; understand business goals, user’s behavior, needs and problems.
●	Create project budget proposals.
●	Produce necessary UX artifacts (screen maps, personas, customer journey maps, wireframes, annotations etc.) for hand-off to customer and project team.
●	Present results to stakeholders and a team, communicate design solutions.
●	Collaborate closely with customers, business analysts, user interface designers, developers and other team members to create consistent, engaging user experiences.
●	Be open to constructive critique from senior UX fellows.
●	Stay abreast of trends in design, technology, and user experience, share your knowledge with others.

ciklum.description:
On behalf of Just Eat, Ciklum is looking for a Middle .NET Software Engineer for our team in Kyiv on full-time basis.

As a rapidly growing company, JUST EAT are always looking for exceptional people at all levels to join us.
ciklum.title: Middle .NET Software Engineer for Just Eat (Kyiv)
ciklum.vacancy:
As stated we are big into AWS and C# and either of these skills are preferred however we are looking for great talent not specific skills If you have experience and passion in any of the following we would like to hear from you. Skills:
•	C#
•	Understanding of cloud computing principles and providers (AWS, Azure, etc.)
•	ASP.NET Web API
•	JavaScript/HTML/CSS
•	SQL Server, MySQL, or similar
•	DynamoDB or similar NoSQL data store
Experiences:
•	Writing automated tests
•	Working in a continuous deployment environment
•	Working within an e-commerce business where reliability is critical
•	Developing systems for both high availability and scalability
•	Performance profiling and tuning
•	Working with message queues and event-driven services Personal qualities:
Our principles are at the core of how we meet our responsibilities. As a member of your team, you’ll need to demonstrate those principles and make them a core part of how you work day to day:
•	Do the right thing 
•	Take responsibility 
•	Be transparent 
•	Continuously improve
•	Take pride •	We’ll believe and trust in you and your abilities. So you and your team will have the authority to make the technical decisions you need to meet your responsibilities to the rest of the platform and company.
•	An environment in which good, evidence-based arguments are always listened to, and will win out.
•	Regular 1-to-1 meetings with your manager, with support and guidance to set and then meet personal career objectives.
•	An open, friendly and fun environment; we have a relaxed dress code and regular social events.
•	Regular hackathons — use your imagination, ideas and technologies of your choice to innovate and deliver prototypes of new products. Every member of the Technology team is responsible for: •	The availability, security, scalability of our ecommerce platform
•	Delivering our product roadmap
•	Planning for the future
•	We don’t divide responsibility for development and operation of our platform, so you and your team will support the changes you make all the way through to operating successfully in production at peak times. Key Capabilities: •	Consistently and in a timely manner produces technically sound solutions to a problem.
•	Experience of working in agile development teams.
•	Follows the standards and practices laid out by the team and company.
•	Deploys and operates in production.

We’re a techy bunch, we’re always looking for ways to do things better, whether it’s improving the performance of an API, improving music compression in the app or exploring the latest Javascript framework. Since 2002 we produced & delivered thousands of campaigns for international clients such as adidas, Tommy Hilfiger, KLM, Procter & Gamble and creative agencies like DDB, Ogilvy and MediaMonks.
ebuilders delivers. Our production work is solid & and scalable. We deliver on time, with no surprises other than a terrific result. Our projects have a short turn-around time and deadlines are tight. Our clients are demanding, we work with A-class designs and the required level of pixel-perfection is very high.
Our headquarters are in Amsterdam. Through Ciklum we have teams in Kiev & Dnipro.
We are an independent production company and part of MediaMonks, the biggest digital production agency on the planet. Find more information about ebuilders, our clients and team on our website and Facebook. 
We now have an opening in Dnipro, for a Front-end Developer.  Responsibilities:

Language:

•	Being a very accurate “pixel-maniac”
•	Being a very accurate, systematic and fast worker, with a high level of self-organization

•	A passionate, international team of developers & digital producers

•	Business trips to our headquarters in Amsterdam
•	Continuous learning & professional development
•	Unique working environment where you communicate and work directly with client

Ciklum is a top-five global Software Engineering and Solutions Company. Our 3,000+ IT professionals are located in the offices and delivery centers in Ukraine, Belarus, Poland and Spain. 
As Ciklum’s employee, you’ll have the unique possibility to communicate directly with the client when working in Extended Teams.

Ciklum is a technology partner for Google, Intel, Micron, and hundreds of world-known companies. We are looking forward to seeing you as a part of our team!

ciklum.description:
On behalf of Aller Media, Ciklum is looking for Full Stack developers to join Odessa team on a full-time basis.

Aller Media (aller.dk) is the leading publisher of magazines and newspapers in the Nordic region with a weekly circulation of approx. 3.2 million copies.
ciklum.title: Full Stack Developer for Aller Media (Odessa)
ciklum.vacancy:
On behalf of Aller Media, Ciklum is looking for Full Stack developers to join Odessa team on a full-time basis. Aller Media (aller.dk) is the leading publisher of magazines and newspapers in the Nordic region with a weekly circulation of approx. 3.2 million copies. In Denmark we have a weekly circulation of approx. 700.000 copies. More than 2 million out of 5 million Danes read one of Allers publications every week. Aller Media is a modern innovative media house located at “Havneholmen” in Copenhagen very close to the city center. Aller Media in Denmark has a market share on weeklies at approx. 73 per cent and approx. 20 per cent on magazines. With our wide range of weeklies and magazines we reach a large part of the Danish population. Among some of our most known publications you will find: BILLED-BLADET, SE og HØR, Familie Journal, Ude og Hjemme, SØNDAG or ELLE. Our range of publications is wide, and we inspire and entertain children, adults and specially women with everything from top model, Vi Unge, IN, ELLE and Antik & Auktion. All our magazines have websites and Facebook profiles, where among other things you can read articles, blogs and participate in contests and much more. In these years Aller Media is moving from traditional print to new media platforms. We were also the first to put all our magazines and weeklies on iPad and iPhone. All subscribers have free access to the electronic versions other ones have to pay for an iPad and/or iPhone access. We need full stack developers. You will be working on many of the brands belonging to the Norwegian part of Aller Media. Our portfolio is based on custom apps based on different frameworks and Labrador CMS. You have an awesome team with you at our office in Odessa, and a set of product owners that are really eager to make great products, both commercial and for our users. In terms of technology we have deiced to move towards Node.js, React and Go as our primary stack as we have moved all into the Google Cloud. There are still some applications running on PHP, but we have a goal of not starting a new project on PHP again. The few PHP applications we still have left are pretty new and will live for quite some time. You don’t have to be a wizard in all languages, but unless you have an open mind, willingness to test and learn, and have a skill to learn new things fast, there is a chance you will become frustrated. And none of us want that. The team is responsible for all development on several of our brands, many of them have several hundred thousand unique users every day! When our new services are set up and in production, they will still need some tender loving care and continuous development. The upside with our team is that the portfolio has stakeholders from a large part of our Norwegian organization. The team we want you to join has an internal credibility of being agile, fast, friendly and fixing real problems. On top of this you will have the room to widen your skillset and become an even better developer. Because we will challenge you! As English is our preferred language for communication (unless you are fluent in Norwegian as well) it is really important that you are skilled in both written and oral English. We have standups on video every morning. As a full stack developer, we don’t expect you to know everything about the business, but if you can understand the issues at hand from a business perspective we believe that will help you produce the best fixes for our problems and contribute with value other than just lines of codes. The interview will be held by our Managing director of development and the Product owner from Aller. We also want you to have a chat with our Ukrainian team-leader. Responsibilities:
We want you to help us create and give the applications in the portfolio the appropriate attention. As a full stack developer you probably know where your key competence will be of best use. Help solving issues everywhere along the stack. Requirements:
• Strong Experience in one or more relevant languages
• Good knowledge of OOP
• Unit test Experience
• Strong English skills Personal skills:
• Dynamic and quality oriented
• Team player, communicative Desirable:
• js, React or Go experience
• Experience with JS/HTML
• Node.js What’s in it for you?
• Friendly and driven team
• Competitive salary
• State of the art, cool, centrally located offices with warm atmosphere which creates really good working conditions
• Team buildings About Ciklum
Ciklum is a top-five global Software Engineering and Solutions Company. Our 3,000+ IT professionals are located in the offices and delivery centres in Ukraine, Belarus, Poland and Spain. As Ciklum’s employee, you’ll have the unique possibility to communicate directly with the client when working in Extended Teams. Besides, Ciklum is the place to make your tech ideas tangible. The Vital Signs Monitor for the Children’s Cardiac Center as well as Smart Defibrillator, the winner of the IoT World Hackathon in the USA, are among the cool things Ciklumers have developed. •	Experience designing and building production Node.js applications with 100% code coverage

•	Experience with build tools, code coverage and testing frameworks — lab, simple-mock, Istanbul, Mocha, Grunt, Gulp, webpack
•	Knowledge of building RESTful web services including GraphQL services Our client is a leading international travel company that has shaped the history of travel and now plans to shape the future of online travel.
The client’s digital strategy is to continue pushing the boundaries on its products’ capabilities, growth and maturity. It plans to accelerate on new technology innovations in the areas of next generation mobile and tablet user experience, ‘big data’ analytics driven personalization, advanced cloud computing and cutting edge social/search technologies.
Despite being a large international organization, our client’s digital team is setup like a small start-up company (without worrying about the next round of funding). Our development teams are small, flexible and they use an agile approach to quickly iterate and test new innovations in the market with our customers. We focus on using the latest open source technologies to innovate and bring together beautiful, cool products and personalized experiences to our customers
Working for our client, you will have the opportunity to solve some of the most difficult problems facing the industry while having a ton of fun. We have a casual office culture with a strong emphasis on innovation, education and empowerment. We expect our teams to do great things and encourage them to be bold, take risks and try new ideas. •	Develop features using best development practices and design patterns

ciklum.vacancy:
On behalf of Ciklum Solutions Team, we are looking for a Senior Java Developer to join our Lviv team on a full-time basis. Our Client provides interconnection solutions, enabling communications service providers and enterprises to discover, route and interact with their customers. The Client also supplies telecom data infrastructure solutions that allow communications service providers to manage all their internal network equipment information as well as interconnections with other networks. Responsibilities:
• Build Number Portability solutions to meet business needs including experimental design and consulting with other external/technology partners.
• Develop and implement server side components in J2EE based architecture including web services.
• Develop and review feature design documents and provide inputs/update to specifications for Number Portability product.
• Implement and test modification requests.
• Handle complex problems that may arise during solution implementation and field support providing creative and rapid solutions. Requirements:
• Experience with Java 7
• Knowledge and experience in the following languages and technologies: Apache/Tomcat, Application server (specifically JBoss).
• Experience with Struts 1.1
• Practical experience with Oracle, SQL, PL/SQL
• Practical experience with SOAP, XML and JSON protocol, Restful web services.
• Extensive knowledge of the Java Spring Framework
• Familiarity with JSP
• Ability to investigate and incorporate new technologies in line with product roadmap
• B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent with 6+ years of experience as a Software Engineer Desirable:
• Understanding and basic experience with AngularJS 4 along HTML 5, CSS/Bootstrap
• Knowledge Unix, Linux operating systems, shell and Perl scripting is a plus
• Large system performance modeling and testing is plus What’s in it for you?
• Career growth opportunities
• Realization of your innovative ideas in building new Ciklum Solutions and Services
• Friendly collaborative teams and enjoyable working environment
• Professional skills development and training programs
• Variety of knowledge sharing, training and self-development opportunities
• State of the art, cool, centrally located offices with warm atmosphere which creates really good working conditions About Ciklum:
Ciklum is a top-five global Software Engineering and Solutions Company. Our 3,000+ IT professionals are located in the offices and delivery centres in Ukraine, Belarus, Poland and Spain. 
As Ciklгm’s employee, you’ll have the unique possibility to communicate directly with the client when working in Extended Teams. Besides, Ciklum is the place to make your tech ideas tangible. It is great possibility to work with the latest technologies on the front-end to design and develop an interactive GUI with many new and exciting front-end features. The candidate will use designed defined using Invision and implement the UX designs as part of the application and get exposure to the back end platform which is going to be a big data analytics platform. Responsibilities:
•	Building and enhancing capabilities of a business intelligence reporting front-end application
•	Review of requirements
•	Software design and research
•	Software development, testing, build and deployment. 
•	Work with an Agile team using tools like Jira and slack for status tracking and collaboration.  Requirements:

ciklum.description:
On behalf of Zerto, Ciklum is looking for a .Net Backend Engineer for our team in Kyiv on full-time basis.

Who are we?

We are Zerto!
Come join a successful, ambitious and fast-growing company!
ciklum.title: .NET Back End Engineer for Zerto (Kyiv)
ciklum.vacancy:
Whom are we looking for? A very smart person, having
•	At least 3 years of C# development experience on complex backend systems.
•	Strong knowledge of OOP (real knowledge. Inheritance, Encapsulation and Polymorphism are not enough).
•	We DO care about unit tests, and you should love writing them WELL.
•	The business domain is complex. Really complex. And you should be ready to invest your time into deep learning that. It will take you much time, and we will invest in you a lot. You should be willing staying with us for a lengthy period of time. This is tough, but the reward will be knowing that your piece of code just saved someone from paying a 1000 bitcoins ransom to a hustler, or even preventing an entire Cyber-attack, and trust us, this is worth working for.
•	Knowing how virtualization (ESXi or Hyper-V) works — is a big plus.
•	Knowing how Cloud platforms work (Azure or AWS) — is even a bigger plus.
•	If you’ve worked with WCF — this is a plus. 
•	If you’ve ever read how networking and SCSI infrastructure works, how UEFI is different from BIOS, and what MBRs are for — is a plus. In short — we would like to work with a person who knows world outside .NET as well. Why are we looking for you? We have a lot of things to do. And we decided to extend one of our Ukrainian teams with talented engineers. You will not just support old 100,000 line of code monster and fix bugs. Or will you? Though project is big and the code base is substantial, we have good engineers, and code is clear enough. And you will develop new features. Sometimes you will fix bugs there. But working with code is not boring at all. Why should you join us? We care about really good engineers. And if you are the one — you will have an ability to apply all your knowledge, take a responsibility, and make a mission critical decisions, working with outstanding engineers around you. Remember, we only hire the best! What will you do? •	Develop mission critical features in our core product, having in mind “code quality over code quantity”. 
•	Talk with other developers to identify how to do it best. 
•	Learn from seniors and help juniors. 
•	Enjoy coding and people around you.

On behalf of eBuilders (ebuilders.nl), Ciklum is looking for Junior QA Specialist to join Dnipro team on a full-time basis. ebuilders specializes in campaign production for advertisers & agencies. Since 2002 we produced & delivered thousands of campaigns for international clients such as adidas, Tommy Hilfiger, Unilever, KLM, Procter & Gamble and agencies like DDB, Ogilvy and MediaMonks. ebuilders delivers. Our production work is solid & and scalable. We deliver on time, with no surprises other than a terrific result. Our projects have a short turn-around time and deadlines are tight. Our clients are demanding, we work with A-class designs and the required level of pixel-perfection is very high. Our headquarters are in Amsterdam and we have digital production team in Dnipro, through Ciklum. ebuilders is part of MediaMonks, world leaders in digital production. Find more information about ebuilders, our clients and team on our website and Facebook. Responsibilities:
• Performs manual, cross-browser testing based on test cases and /or input files reference files
• Reports bugs in JIRA
• Assists in reproducing reported bugs, provides clear & sufficient description of defects cause-effect
• Re-tests a product, re-opens the issues if necessary, performs acceptance testing (final QA sign-off)

•	Strong Adobe Photoshop skills

•	PC literate, fast & accurate worker

•	Excellent communication skills, be able to start a conversation with strangers/foreigners easily

•	A passionate, international team of developers & digital producers
•	Continuous learning & professional development

•	Excellent pay
•	Business trips to our headquarters in Amsterdam About Ciklum
Ciklum is a top-five global Software Engineering and Solutions Company. Our 3,000+ IT professionals are located in the offices and delivery centres in Ukraine, Belarus, Poland and Spain. 
As Ciklum’s employee, you’ll have the unique possibility to communicate directly with the client when working in Extended Teams.

softserve.description: SoftServe is opening a new position for Senior Java Engineer. Our client provides secure voice transactions for Cardholder Not Present (CNP) payments.
softserve.title: Senior Java Engineer
softserve.vacancy:
We are shifting from a monolithic application to a series of scalable, Java 8 microservices. This takes a considerable amount engineering activity that will require the current team to double in size. As a Senior Java Engineer, you will have a thorough understanding of Object Oriented Programming and have significant experience in Java 7 and 8. Entering the role with significant commercial experience, preferably in an Enterprise environment, you are well versed in developing Java Applications and are eloquently able to explain the benefits of writing maintainable, reusable and easily testable code.  We are looking for analytical thinkers who have the ability to engage with and describe their thought process around the use of Java-based technology. You will be comfortable presenting to a group using a whiteboard to illustrate prior projects, decisions and technical solutions.  It is important that you have experience writing tests for your own code. We use JUnit, but any Java testing framework will suffice. We also expect that you will have experience mocking frameworks for testing and of integration testing. While we don’t practice TDD, it is useful to have an understanding of the principles of writing good tests and deciphering error messages. You also must have a good understanding of, and preferably worked with, Core Spring as it will form the basis of your daily work. You will have awareness of high-level development concepts, with an insight into software engineering practices and system architecture ideally including SOA, Restful web services and API experience. Additionally, regardless of experience, you will be comfortable working with Tomcat, Linux, Maven as build tools and Git for source control.  Essentially, to fit into our way of working you must have worked in a CI/CD environment and ideally bring with you any experience you have with Docker.  Finally, we are looking for enthusiasm and passion for a career in Software Engineering — someone who has a strong desire to continue learning and stretching themselves. You will be a pragmatic, educated approach to your job and find it natural to voice clear opinions about new tech and tools. At a high level we have 3 modules to convert from using JBoss to using Tomcat (and be container agnostic in future). 
Data processing module (DPM) tasks:
∙ Ensure ClassA uses HTTP instead of EJB
∙ Produce base Tomcat Debian package 
∙ Remove EJB option for ClientAPI 
∙ Package DPM as a WAR instead of EAR 
∙ Convert ClassB to Spring JmsTemplate or equivalent
∙ Convert ClassC to Spring @JMSListener/JmsTemplate or equivalent
∙ Ensure DPM actually runs correctly in tomcat
∙ Delete EJB project completely
∙ Alter DPM JBoss package to use Tomcat Debian dependency
∙ Remove usages of getters inside ClassD
∙ Add JBoss -> Tomcat upgrade script to Debian package
∙ Remove JBoss specific metadata files
∙ Remove all references to DEFAULT_JNDI_PREFIX_NAME and SERVICE_NAME
∙ Investigate if using HTTP instead of EJB works correctly Web Module (WM) Tasks
∙ Remove EJB option for WebModule 
∙ Ensure WM is installed inside Tomcat instead of JBoss Payment Module (PM) tasks
∙ Investigate if payment module tests subproject can be resurrected
∙ Payment Module needs tests
∙ Ensure PM actually runs correctly in tomcat
∙ Ensure PM is installed inside Tomcat
∙ Remove JBoss profile in Accounts module POM
∙ Add JBoss -> Tomcat upgrade script to Debian package
∙ Ensure PM is packaged as a standalone WAR instead of an EAR 
∙ Delete ’Security’ project in the Gateway repository
